member.name: T:StreamCoders.LogFactory2
member.summary: Class LogFactory2 for arbitrary string names

member.name: T:StreamCoders.LogFactoryBase
member.summary: Base class for logging from type T and an arbitrary string name

members.member:
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event that is raised whenever a sample is available. Events and polling (GetNextSamples) cannot be mixed.
The event must be added before the Start method is called.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Initializes AVI class and creates filename for further processing.
Needs to be called before adding the tracks. [in,out] If non-null, filename of the file. Returns true on success, otherwise false.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Overload.
Same as calling WriteTrack with KeyFrame parameter set to false. [in,out] Pass the TrackInfo used in AddTrack. [in,out] Pass MediaPackage containing buffer of frame to be written to specific track.
true if it succeeds, false if it fails.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Transforms the given input buffer.
If the inputBuffer is an instance of PictureMediaBuffer all necessary metadata like resolution will be copied to the newly created object.
[in,out] If non-null, buffer for input data.
Returns the status of the operation.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Provides stabilization of video from shaky cameras.
Note that CPU utilization can be relatively high when using video stabilization. We therefore recommend not to use this class in live streaming scenarios.
Video stabilization is only available on Windows Vista/7/8.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A Face detector using Histogram of oriented gradients and linear classifier
Note that a AVX2 capable CPU is required in order to use FaceDetector
Set position \param pos Ipp64f (0:1.0) \retval OK \note set position in the stream (file size * pos)
Move position on npos bytes \param npos integer (+/-) bytes \retval UMC_OK \retval UMC_ERR_NOT_INITIALIZED object was not initialize

Read nsize bytes and copy to data (return number bytes which was copy) Cache data in case of small nsize \param data pointer to the data where copy nsize byte from stream \param nsize integer - number bytes \retval UMC_OK \retval UMC_ERR_NOT_INITIALIZED object was not initialize \retval UMC_ERR_END_OF_STREAM end of stream \retval UMC_ERR_FAILED can't map
Reset all internal parameters \retval UMC_OK \retval UMC_ERR_NOT_INITIALIZED object was not initialize

Create and map first portion from file \param InitParams Pointer to the init (for filereader it's vm_char file_name[255] and portion_size \retval UMC_OK \retval UMC_ERR_OPEN_FAILED file was not open \retval UMC_ERR_INIT wrong page size
Default constructor Sets m_file_name to empty string and m_portion_size to 0
Read nsize bytes and copy to data (return number bytes which was copy). Cache data in case of small nsize
Reset all internal parameters to start reading from begin

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Detect DTMF in a PCM Stream. Possible characters are: 0-9, A-D, '*' and '#'. The minimum duration for a tone to be detected is 40ms.
[in,out] If non-null, the buffer.
Returns a String representing DTMF tones, otherwise String is empty.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Initializes VoiceActivityDetection.
Any derivation of AudioDecoderConfiguration is accepted. BitsPerSample, SampleRate and Channels must be set.
true if it succeeds, false if it fails.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sets transfer buffer size given milliseconds using Formula: SR * CH * BPS * milliseconds / 1000.
This function must be called after setting SampleRate, Channels and BitsPerSample, but before Init().
The milliseconds. Must be less or equal 1000.
Returns the calculated transfer buffer size.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets or sets the number of Transfer buffers.
Stepping into an application with delay of execution, can cause data bursts from the device and faulty information to be transferred to the application, because of the limited amount and circular nature of transfer buffers.
The amount of transfer buffers used. Default: 50.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets or sets the size of each of the buffers used to transfer data from the sound device to the application.
If set to 0, WaveInput will create 10 millisecond buffers.
Stepping into an application with delay of execution, can cause data bursts from the device and faulty information to be transferred to the application, because of the limited amount and circular nature of transfer buffers.
The delay in readiness of data is directly proportional to the size of the buffer.
Meaning: The smaller the buffer, the sooner data is made available to the application.
Adjustments must be made before calling Start().
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets or sets the channel mask present in the multichannel stream. Audio interleave channel numbers start from lowest to highest value in channel mask bit-flags. (Stereo: Interleave 0 -> Left (0x1), Interleave 1 -> Right (0x2))
Default value is Speaker_Default for default arrangement.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Event that is raised whenever a sample is available. Events and polling (GetNextSamples) cannot be mixed.
The event must be added before the Start method is called.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Encodes an array of PCM data to the selected codec and stores it in a byte array.
Note: The size of the input data is dependent on the value of MaximumInputDataLength
[in,out] If non-null, the buffer. null if it fails, else.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Encodes an array of PCM data to the selected codec and stores it in a byte array.
Note: The size of the input data is dependent on the value of MaximumInputDataLength
[in,out] If non-null, the buffer. [in,out] The offset into the buffer. [in,out] The number of bytes to process. null if it fails, else.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Encodes an array of PCM data to the selected codec and stores it in an RTP Frame.
Note: The size of the input data is dependent on the value of MaximumInputDataLength
[in,out] If non-null, the buffer. null if it fails, else.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
SpeechEncoder handles the encoding of speech audio frames.
SpeechEncoder handles 16-bit sample sizes and 1 channel.
Supported codecs are:
G.711A
G.711U
G.722
G.722SB
G.723
G.726
G.728
G.729A
AMR-NB
AMR-WB
AMR-WBE
Enhanced Voice Services
SPEEX-NB
SPEEX-WB
SpeechEncoder is able to produce raw bitstreams and RTP streams.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Fixed point Opus audio encoder.
Supported Sampling rates: 8000, 12000, 16000, 24000, or 48000
Supported number of channels: 1, 2
The default duration is 20ms.
Bitrates range from 500 to 512000 bits per second.
The Transform function must be called from the same thread the object was created on.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets decoder specific configuration string. This function is currently not support for MP3Encoder class.
null if it fails, else the decoder configuration information.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Un-Protects an RTCP compound packet.
[in,out] [in,out] Must contain a valid RTCP compound packet. If the un-protection process is successful, the output will be a newly created RTCP compound packet.
Returns StatusOk on success.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Un-Protects an RTP packet.
[in,out] [in,out] Must contain a valid RTP packet. If the un-protection process is successful, the output will be a newly created RTP packet.
Returns StatusOk on success.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Un-Protects RTP and RTCP content. If the function is successful, the referenced input parameter will be replaced by a new OffsetBuffer object.
[in,out] [in,out] Must contain a valid RTP packet or RTCP compound packet. If the un-protection process is successful, the output will be a newly created RTP packet or RTCP compound packet.
True if the passed packet is an RTCP packet. False if the passed packet is an RTP packet.
Returns StatusOk on success.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Protects an RTCP compound packet.
[in,out] [in,out] Must contain a valid RTCP compound packet. If the protection process is successful, the output will be a newly created RTCP compound packet.
Returns StatusOk on success.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Protects an RTP packet.
[in,out] [in,out] Must contain a valid RTP packet. If the protection process is successful, the output will be a newly created RTP packet.
Returns StatusOk on success.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Protects RTP and RTCP content. If the function is successful, the referenced input parameter will be replaced by a new OffsetBuffer object.
[in,out] [in,out] Must contain a valid RTP packet or RTCP compound packet. If the protection process is successful, the output will be a newly created RTP packet or RTCP compound packet.
True if the passed packet is an RTCP packet. False if the passed packet is an RTP packet.
Returns StatusOk on success.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Removes the stream described by streamConfiguration.
The stream configuration to remove.
Returns StatusOk on success.
Note that only stream added with SynchronizationSourceType equal to Specific can be removed from a session. The SynchronizationSourceTypeOutboundAny wildcard can only be added and never removed.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Represents an SRTP session which provides a secure facility for RTP communication.
An SRTP session can contain multiple streams with indiviual crypto suites and key exchange methods.
Each stream is considered an RTP/RTCP pair, with their own key definition. The sender always defines the methods of encryption. The signaling is usually SDP (SDES).
Please see the SRtpSample on how to use this class.
This class is thread-safe. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Attempts to predict the frame type by finding the start-code and looking at the NAL unit type.
The function limits search to the first 20 bytes of a buffer.
If there are multiple NALs passed, then only the first will be identified. In order to identify all NALs, use H264Transform.ExtractNals to split them into separate buffers first.
Predict currently only works with start-code escaped NAL units. AU (e.g. VideoSource = FILE_MP4) frames are not supported.
[in,out] Input buffer.
Returns the frame type or NO_FRAME if not found.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Decodes the content of the buffer into a uncompressed RGB24 frame. This may also contain timing information.
Not all input frames may deliver a picture immediately. Depending on the composition and frame type (B-Frames), frame decoding can be deferred to a later point in time.
In case of packet loss or discontinuities in the decoded stream, for example when bitrates are switched in an adaptive streaming scenario, the input buffer should set MediaBuffer.IsDiscontinuity = true; If non-null, the media pack.
null if it fails, else.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Attempts to predict the frame type by finding the start-code and looking at the NAL unit type. Input buffer. Returns the frame type or NO_FRAME if not found.
The function limits search to the first 20 bytes of a buffer.
If there are multiple NALs passed, then only the first will be identified. In order to identify all NALs, use H264Transform.ExtractNals to split them into separate buffers first.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Decodes the content of the buffer into a uncompressed RGB24 frame. This may also contain timing information.
Not all input frames may deliver a picture immediately. Depending on the composition and frame type (B-Frames), frame decoding can be deferred to a later point in time. [in,out] If non-null, the media pack. null if it fails, else.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Creates a video decoder object based on codec enumeration value.
The codec to create.
Returns a newly created decoder object, otherwise null.
Note that in case of an unknown codec, the function will return a NullVideoDecoder object.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Decodes the content of the buffer into a uncompressed RGB24 frame. This may also contain timing information.
Not all input frames may deliver a picture immediately. Depending on the composition and frame type (B-Frames), frame decoding can be deferred to a later point in time. [in,out] If non-null, the media pack. null if it fails, else.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Initializes this H263Encoder instance.
The configuration to use.
nullptr if it fails, else an updated version of the passed configuration. The initialization result is contained in InitializationStatus -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
H.263 video Encoder
Currently H.263 encoder supports baseline profile plus Annexes D, F, G, I, J, M, O, P, S, T of the ITU-T Recommendation H.263.
In additional to un-encapsulated (raw) data, the Encoder is able to produce RFC 2190, RFC 2429, RFC 4629 RTP frames.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets or sets the Playback rate.
Not all devices support this feature. Check Capabilities property for indication.
The rate is specified as a fixed-point value. The high-order word contains the signed integer part of the number, and the low-order word contains the fractional part. A value of 0x8000 in the low-order word represents one-half, and 0x4000 represents one-quarter. For example, the value 0x00010000 specifies a multiplier of 1.0 (no playback rate change), and a value of 0x000F8000 specifies a multiplier of 15.5.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets or sets the Pitch.
Not all devices support this feature. Check Capabilities property for indication.
The pitch multiplier is specified as a fixed-point value. The high-order word contains the signed integer part of the number, and the low-order word contains the fractional part. A value of 0x8000 in the low-order word represents one-half, and 0x4000 represents one-quarter. For example, the value 0x00010000 specifies a multiplier of 1.0 (no pitch change), and a value of 0x000F8000 specifies a multiplier of 15.5.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets or sets the Volume.
Not all devices support this feature. Check Capabilities property for indication.
The low-order word contains the left-channel volume setting, and the high-order word contains the right-channel setting. A value of 0xFFFF represents full volume, and a value of 0x0000 is silence. If a device does not support both left and right volume control, the low-order word of dwVolume specifies the volume level, and the high-order word is ignored.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets or sets the channel mask present in the multichannel stream. Audio interleave channel numbers start from lowest to highest value in channel mask bit-flags. (Stereo: Interleave 0 -> Left (0x1), Interleave 1 -> Right (0x2))
Default value is Speaker_Default for default arrangement.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Unprepares internally allocated buffers. This function can be called to remove memory pressure, if large chunk(s) of audio data have been enqueued.
UnprepareBuffers is also internally called by Enqueue but not by other methods. It must be called before getting accurate results from QueuedBytes, QueuedSamples or QueuedSamplesInSeconds.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Provides SPS/PPS configuration data for decoders.
This function will only return valid data after the first frame was successfully encoded.
Returns buffer containing information, otherwise null if information is not yet available.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Initializes the H.264 encoder instance.
The encoder supports updating its bitrate settings by calling Init() during operation for all rate control types.
The configuration to use.
nullptr if it fails, else an updated version of the passed configuration. The initialization result is contained in InitializationStatus -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Provides SPS/PPS configuration data for decoders.
This function will only return valid data after the first frame was successfully encoded.
Returns buffer containing information, otherwise null if information is not yet available.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Initializes the H.264 encoder instance.
The encoder supports updating its bitrate settings by calling Init() during operation for all rate control types.
The configuration to use.
nullptr if it fails, else an updated version of the passed configuration. The initialization result is contained in InitializationStatus -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Provides SPS/PPS configuration data for decoders.
This function will only return valid data after the first frame was successfully encoded.
Returns buffer containing information, otherwise null if information is not yet available.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Initializes the H.264 encoder instance.
The encoder supports updating its bitrate settings by calling Init() during operation for all rate control types.
The configuration to use.
nullptr if it fails, else an updated version of the passed configuration. The initialization result is contained in InitializationStatus -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Rotates a PictureMediaBuffer arounds its center coordinates. Note this function does not resize the resulting PictureMediaBuffer. Supported pixel formats are RGB-24 and RGB-32.
[in,out] If non-null, buffer for input data.
[in] Angle of rotation.
The resulting PictureMediaBuffer object or null.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Rotates a PictureMediaBuffer arounds its center coordinates. Note this function does not resize the resulting PictureMediaBuffer.
[in,out] If non-null, buffer for input data.
[in] Angle of rotation.
The resulting PictureMediaBuffer object or null.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Rotates a PictureMediaBuffer arounds its center coordinates. Note this function does not resize the resulting PictureMediaBuffer.
[in,out] If non-null, buffer for input data.
[in] Angle of rotation.
The resulting PictureMediaBuffer object or null.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Converts a 24-bit/32-bit bitmap to PictureMediaBuffer of type Rgb32. The alpha value will default to 255.
Must contain a 24-bit or 32-bit System.Drawing.Bitmap.
null if it fails, else the converted image.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Calculates weighted sum where (BufferX1 * alpha) + (BufferX2 * (1-alpha)). The result of the function is stored in BufferX2.
Buffer containing gray scale picture.
Buffer containing gray scale picture.
The alpha value has to be between 0.0 and 1.0.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Applies vertical Prewitt filter on a 8-bit gray scale image. The kernel size is 3x3.
[in,out] If non-null, buffer for input data.
null if it fails, else the a newly created image with the filter applied.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Applies horizontal Prewitt filter on a 8-bit gray scale image. The kernel size is 3x3.
[in,out] If non-null, buffer for input data.
null if it fails, else the a newly created image with the filter applied.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Applies vertical Sobel filter on a 8-bit gray scale image. The kernel size is 3x3.
[in,out] If non-null, buffer for input data.
null if it fails, else the a newly created image with the filter applied.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Calculates the absolute difference between two 24-bit images.
Buffer containing gray scale picture.
Buffer containing gray scale picture.
[in,out] Result of absolute difference operation. The buffer must be pre-allocated.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Calculates absolute difference abs(X1(ij) - X2(ij)) between two gray scale images.
[in,out] Buffer containing gray scale picture.
[in,out] Buffer containing gray scale picture.
[in,out] Result of absolute difference operation. The buffer must be pre-allocated.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sets pixels to a new value when they are greater than a threshold value.
[in,out] Input buffer containing 8-bit gray scale image.
The threshold.
The new value to assign when threshold is reached.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Converts an 8-bit gray scale image to a 24-bit image.
Input buffer containing 8-bit gray scale image.
[in,out] Pre-allocated buffer required for RGB-24 image.
true if it succeeds, false if it fails.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Converts a YUY2 composite to RGB-24 bit image.
Input buffer containing YUY2 composite image.
[in,out] Pre-allocated buffer required for 24-bit image.
true if it succeeds, false if it fails.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Converts a RGB-24 bit image to 8-bit gray scale.
Input buffer containing RGB-24 image.
[in,out] Pre-allocated buffer required for 8-bit gray scale image.
true if it succeeds, false if it fails.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: M:StreamCoders.Devices.VideoCaptureDeviceSelectionForm.InitializeComponent
member.summary: Required method for Designer support - do not modify the contents of this method with the code editor.

member.name: M:StreamCoders.Devices.VideoCaptureDeviceSelectionForm.Dispose
member.summary: Clean up any resources being used.

members.member:
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Detects whether a capture device is lost during operation. This can happen if a capture device is physically disconnected.
The device should be stopped after this property evaluates to true and rediscovered with GetDeviceList.
true if this object is device lost, false if not.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets the mode of the VideoCaptureDevice object.
When in Basic Mode it is ensured that only metrics compatible to other MediaSuite components will be returned from SelectDevice.
SelectedFormat other than 24-bit will not be returned. (Currently the only restriction)
Default: true.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Retrieves a raw frame containing timing information of capture (MediaBuffer.startTime) and duration based on the FPS of the selected profile (MediaBuffer.EndTime). The timing information is relative to the time VideoCaptureDevice.Start was called.
Returns a MediaPackage object containing a raw picture and timing information.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Start the capturing process from the selected Device Name.
Returns true on success, otherwise false. False can indicate that the device in incompatible or is already started.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Select metrics for a previously selected device.
[in,out] Pass VideoCaptureDeviceFormat previously returned by SelectDevice Returns true of metrics are supported, otherwise false.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Selects a capture device to be used and returns metrics of that device. A CaptureDeviceInformation object returned by GetDeviceList Returns a list of metrics supported by the device.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

This class represents a simple interface to capture devices. It can be used to retrieve pictures from these devices.
Supported features:
Enumerating Captures device located on system
Setting Resolution and framerate of Video
Retrieving frames from capture devices
Class instances are reusable.
It is possible to select and configure another device while a VideoCaptureDevice is running. To make the new configuration active Stop and Start has to be executed.
Using VideoCaptureDevice:
Enumerate Devices
SelectDevice
SelectCaptureDeviceFormat
Start
Use device by capturing images
Stop
Dispose
Video capture devices can only be started once on a system. To re-use a VideoCaptureDevice the CaptureDeviceMulticastProvider can help provide multiple streams from a capture device in a single process. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Video capture device.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Decodes the content of the buffer into a uncompressed RGB24 frame. This may also contain timing information.
Not all input frames may deliver a picture immediately. Depending on the composition and frame type (B-Frames), frame decoding can be deferred to a later point in time. [in,out] Video frame to decode. null if it fails, else.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
MPEG-4.2 Decoder.
Streamcoders MPEG-4 Decoder is an ISO/IEC 14496-2 conforming decoder.
Supported Features
Short video header
Data partitioning
Reversible VLC
Constant/Variable Bitrates
Interlacing
Quarter Pixel MC -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets decoder specific configuration string. This is used in SDP and other media capability description methods to initialize a decoder.
null if it fails, else the decoder configuration information.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets decoder specific configuration string. This is used in SDP and other media capability description methods to initialize a decoder.
null if it fails, else the decoder configuration information.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Generates a tone at a given frequency. Frequency of the tone to be generated. The duration in milliseconds of the generated signal. Unsigned power level [0;63] Amp = 10^(volume/10) Constant phase offset. null if it fails, else.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Generates a tone at a given frequency. Frequency of the tone to be generated. The duration in milliseconds of the generated signal. Unsigned power level [0;63] Amp = 10^(volume/10) null if it fails, else.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Decodes an OffsetBuffer to PCM.
Note: The size of the input data is dependent on the value of MaximumInputDataLength
[in,out] Buffer containing speech encoded data stream. Returns PCM data, otherwise null in case of insufficient input data.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sets the codec type of the data to be decoded and default frame duration.
The codec to use.
Optional codec specific data is currently only used for AMR codec types when RTP is used. This method is obsolete. Please use SetCodec(Codec, ISpeechDecoderSpecificConfiguration) overload. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
SpeechDecoder handles the decoding of speech audio frames.
SpeechDecoder handles 16-bit sample sizes and 1 channel.
Supported codecs are:
G.711A
G.711U
G.722
G.722SB
G.723
G.726 (Re-amplified)
G.728
G.729A
AMR-NB
AMR-WB
AMR-WBE
Enhanced Voice Services (EVS)
SPEEX-NB
SPEEX-WB -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Decodes a raw Mp3 Stream.
[in,out] Encoded frame with optional timing information.
Decoded Frame, including timing information, or null indicating that not enough data was supplied.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
AAC - MPEG-4.3 Audio Decoder.
Supported Profiles: LC, MAIN, LTP, ALS
Extensions: SBR (HE-AAC v1), PS (HE-AAC v2)
Frequencies: 8k-96k
The decoder will auto-detect ADIF and ADTS streams. (For ADIF it is important that the first frame produced by the encoder is also passed to the decoder).
When Raw stream are used, the decoder must be initialized with decoder specific data from the AacAudioDecoderConfiguration instance.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Applies filter to image. Since the algorithm use is temporal of nature there is a 3 picture delay before results can be consumed.
Buffer containg image.
Returns newly created buffer with filters applied, otherwise null.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: F:StreamCoders.Imaging.AdaptiveBlurMethod.Method3
member.summary: Uses previous and next result to calculate the current pixel.

member.name: F:StreamCoders.Imaging.AdaptiveBlurMethod.Method2
member.summary: Uses previous pixel and next result of calcuation to calculate the current pixel.

member.name: F:StreamCoders.Imaging.AdaptiveBlurMethod.Method1
member.summary: Uses previous results of calculation and next pixel to calculate the current pixel.

member.name: F:StreamCoders.Imaging.AdaptiveBlurMethod.Method0
member.summary: Uses previous and next pixel to calculate current pixel.

members.member:
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Resamples audio data.
Input buffer containing samples specified by Resampler.Input parameters.
Returns a buffer of resampled data, specified by Resampler.Output parameters.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Provides SPS/PPS configuration data for decoders.
This function will only return valid data after the first frame was successfully encoded.
Returns buffer containing information, otherwise null if information is not yet available.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Initializes the H.264 encoder instance.
The encoder supports updating its bitrate settings by calling Init() during operation for all rate control types.
The configuration to use.
nullptr if it fails, else an updated version of the passed configuration. The initialization result is contained in InitializationStatus -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Initializes this MPEG4Encoder instance.
The configuration to use.
nullptr if it fails, else an updated version of the passed configuration. The initialization result is contained in InitializationStatus -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
MPEG-4.2 Encoder.
Streamcoders MPEG-4 Encoder is an ISO/IEC 14496-2 conforming encoder.
Supported Features
Data partitioning
Reversible VLC
Constant/Variable Bitrates
Interlacing
Motion Estimation method: Full, Fast; Accuracy: Full, Half, Quarter; Vectors: 1, 4
Support for I/P/B-Frames The Encoder is also able to output RFC 3016 conforming RTP frames, with packet size restrictions.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
\overload \return UMC_OK if the option is met. UMC_WRN_TYPE_MISMATCH if it has arguments. UMC_ERR_NOT_FOUND if there was no such option

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Select metrics for a previously selected device.
[in,out] Pass VideoCaptureDeviceFormat previously returned by SelectDevice Returns true of metrics are supported, otherwise false.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Selects a capture device to be used and returns metrics of that device. A CaptureDeviceInformation object returned by GetDeviceList Returns a list of metrics supported by the device.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Captures the next frame from the desktop and stores it in an already created buffer.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Provides high performance Desktop screen capturing using Desktop Duplication..
This class can currently only be used on Windows 8+ platforms.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Decodes the content of the buffer into a uncompressed RGB24 frame. This may also contain timing information.
Not all input frames may deliver a picture immediately. Depending on the composition and frame type (B-Frames), frame decoding can be deferred to a later point in time. [in,out] If non-null, the media pack. null if it fails, else.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Decodes a WMA frame. [in,out] Encoded frame with optional timing information. Decoded Frame, including timing information, or null indicating that not enough data was supplied.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
